intro: Oenothera gauriflora var. vermiculata, commonly known as the silverleaf evening primrose, is a species native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silvery-white, velvety leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers emit a pleasant fragrance at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant's unique foliage and flowering habit make it a valuable addition to xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
